title: Popcorn!
body:
Popcorn! 

Word Count: 243

Arya starred at the tv screen her head tilted to the side, slowly putting in a piece of popcorn.  She seemed bored to anyone who would look at her.  Her eyes tilted to the side, to see her boyfriend, Gendry, clinging to the bowl for dear life.  Arya rolled her eyes as her eyes went back to the horror movie.  

Just as the man with the chainsaw was about to come on, the doorbell rang, causing Gendry to yell throwing the bowl of popcorn up in the air.  Arya glared at him, brushing some popcorn out of her hair.  

“Don’t answer it!”  Gendry called, hiding behind the sofa.  She rolled her eyes, opening the door to find 4 Trick or Treaters.  

“Trick or Treat!”  Comes from outside.  Gendry relaxes, while Arya laughs.  

“It’s Not funny Arie!”  He yells.  Arya gives candy to everyone, smiling at all of them.  Closing their door, she makes eye contact with Gendry locking the door.  Turning off the porch light, making sure everyone knows they don’t have anymore candy to give, she makes her way to the couch brushing some popcorn off.  

“I’ll protect you.”  She laughs opening her arms.  He wiggles into her lap, grumbling the entire time, before they found a comfortable position.  Brushing off some popcorn in his hair, she kisses his forehead.  

“It’s still not funny, you know I don’t like horror films.”  

“Happy Halloween.”  She pokes his side, making him jump.  “Scaredy cat.”   

Masterlist

annalesa / 27 / pisces /
they would not make her yield

summary: "Arry, come on! Lommy's gone, leave her if she won't come!"  Stubbornly, Arya dragged all the harder, pulling the crying girl...
body:
“Arry, come on! Lommy’s gone, leave her if she won’t come!" 
Stubbornly, Arya dragged all the harder, pulling the crying girl along.

But Arya would not leave until they found Yoren. They couldn’t have killed him, she told herself, he was too hard and tough, and a brother of the Night’s Watch besides. She said as much to Gendry as they searched among the corpses.

”Then just leave him, Arry,“ Lommy pleaded. "They don’t know about the rest of us. If we hide, they’ll go away, you know they will. It’s not our fault Gendry’s captured." […]
“Anyhow, I don’t care what you say, I’m going back for him.”

She would make much better time on her own, Arya knew, but she could not leave them. They were her pack, her friends, the only living friends that remained to her, and if not for her they would still be safe at Harrenhal.

even if it means risking her own life or at the expense of her goals arya will not leave her people behind.

blog.name: we-are-rogue
blog.title: we are Rogue
blog.description:
Gallery | D&D | Fiction | Theory | Practice | Iconic | Tags and Masterposts

Inspiration and resources for Rogues, the most resourceful player class and fantasy archetype of them all.

Jacks of all trades and masters of none, thieves, outlaws, rascals, scoundrels, pickpockets, cutpurses, cat burglars, bandits, con artists, assassins, infiltrators, highwaymen, spies, swashbucklers, smugglers, pirates, thugs, jesters, tricksters, skillmonkeys, specialists, factotums, and the occasional ronin: we are ROGUE.

summary: Who do you think will kill Cersei (if she dies)?Most people assume it will be Jaime or Tyrion but i’ve also seen people saying...
question: Who do you think will kill Cersei (if she dies)?Most people assume it will be Jaime or Tyrion but i’ve also seen people saying it could be Arya.  Sorry if you’ve already answered this.
answer:
First, I think the theory that Arya is the valonqar is easily discounted. She’s a younger sibling capable of killing people and she hates Cersei. As we see when valonqar theorising comes up, there’s a substantial list of people who fit those criteria. The prophecy, however, is about Cersei and Cersei’s self-destruction. We’re looking for someone who Cersei has shaped profoundly. That’s not Arya. Arya’s got her own story. Narratively (and much like Sansa), she’s got better things to do than dispose of a villain who’s perfectly, tragically capable of disposing of herself.

Cersei’s misunderstanding and misinterpretation of the prophecy she received is absolutely central to how she will ultimately bring it about. She’s believed Tyrion to be the valonqar all his life; she does not get to be right about that. Her ableist reasoning will not be validated.

Instead, the valonqar is the one person Cersei trusts to any significant degree. The only person she would (and has!) actively ruled out being her valonqar, and whose devotion to her she takes for granted. In short: Jaime.

blog.name: incorrect-got-quotes
blog.title: Dead, almost like my interest in the show
blog.description: I post quotes when I feel like it. Mostly nowadays I don’t.If you want to use one of the quotes as a story or drawing prompt, I'm fine with that, as long as you credit me in your story or art. Also, tag any drawings under #oberyn’s saucy art. Yes, I am in fact Oberyn Martell. For those on mobile, here is my ship list: https://incorrect-got-quotes.tumblr.com/list-of-ships Main: garnetislovegarnetislife. SUBMISSION BOX IS (MOST LIKELY) PERMANENTLY CLOSED!

summary:
(After Arya has second thoughts about becoming a Faceless Man)
Jaqen, to Arya: Are we gonna have a problem?
Jaqen: You got a...
body:
(After Arya has second thoughts about becoming a Faceless Man)

Jaqen, to Arya: Are we gonna have a problem?

Jaqen: You got a bone to pick?

Jaqen: You’ve come so far. Why now are you pulling on my dick?

Jaqen: I’d normally slap your face off.

Jaqen: And everyone here could watch.

Jaqen: But I’m feeling nice, here’s some advice: listen up bee-otch!

summary:
(At Winterfell)
Daenerys: By the Gods, it’s cold here.
Arya: Here, take my jacket. I’m not even that cold.
Daenerys: Thank you....
body:
(At Winterfell)

Daenerys: By the Gods, it’s cold here.

Arya: Here, take my jacket. I’m not even that cold.

Daenerys: Thank you. I’ll give this back to you tomorrow.

(Later, in her chambers)

Daenerys, while sniffing the jacket in order to smell Arya’s scent: I’m never giving this back.

(Later, in her chambers)

Daenerys, while sniffing the jacket in order to smell Arya’s scent: I’m never giving this back.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary:
At the end of the day, Jonsa is just a
crackship that has attracted a lot of attention and hate because of their tendency to...
body:
At the end of the day, Jonsa is just a crackship that has attracted a lot of attention and hate because of their tendency to come up with shit like undercover!Jon and power hungry/evil Dany. Usually it’s ship and let ship, but the constant shitting on Jon and Dany and turning them into villains is what I think many people find annoying about Jonsa. The right response to Jonsa will always be Hannah Murray’s when she was asked about it at a convention 😂

Hannah Murray ships Sansa/Tyrion by the way. Expect some nice Sansa/Tyrion scenes next season.

It’s kind of funny that Jon x Dany shippers have been caught up in a ship war with a crackship like Jonsa over this long two year hiatus. I am pretty certain that Jon will have very limited scenes with Sansa next season considering he will be reuniting back with the characters that form a big part of his story in the books - Arya, Bran, Sam, Ghost etc. I bet that little hug we saw in the 1 second promo and some other scenes with everyone else in the great hall of WF in episode one is all the Jon/Sansa interaction we will have next season. Sansa has her own story to do after that and Jon has his.

If the Jon/Dany ship is going to be threatened by any relationship next season in terms of time devoted to their relationship on screen, it’s going to be Jon/Arya  😂. GRRM has all that time invested in Jon/Arya over 5 books and we are going to see how it all ends between them next season and Jon & Arya have always had that special bond.

I am sure that the Jonarya shippers are just waiting in the wings biding their time till next season 😂. I don’t think we will get anything in the promos or trailers for them because their reunion is the most awaited event of next season.

As a Jon fan though, next season is going to be a feast of character interactions for him - Jon-Arya, Jon-Ghost, Jon-Sam, Jon - Bran, Jon -Jaime!

Besides Jon-Dany has just started and we have to see how their relationship progresses as well!

Sansa has her own story to do after that and Jon has his.

If the Jon/Dany ship is going to be threatened by any relationship next season in terms of time devoted to their relationship on screen, it’s going to be Jon/Arya  😂. GRRM has all that time invested in Jon/Arya over 5 books and we are going to see how it all ends between them next season and Jon & Arya have always had that special bond.

I am sure that the Jonarya shippers are just waiting in the wings biding their time till next season 😂. I don’t think we will get anything in the promos or trailers for them because their reunion is the most awaited event of next season.

As a Jon fan though, next season is going to be a feast of character interactions for him - Jon-Arya, Jon-Ghost, Jon-Sam, Jon - Bran, Jon -Jaime!

Besides Jon-Dany has just started and we have to see how their relationship progresses as well!
trail.content:
At the end of the day, Jonsa is just a crackship that has attracted a lot of attention and hate because of their tendency to come up with shit like undercover!Jon and power hungry/evil Dany. Usually it’s ship and let ship, but the constant shitting on Jon and Dany and turning them into villains is what I think many people find annoying about Jonsa. The right response to Jonsa will always be Hannah Murray’s when she was asked about it at a convention 😂

Hannah Murray ships Sansa/Tyrion by the way. Expect some nice Sansa/Tyrion scenes next season.

It’s kind of funny that Jon x Dany shippers have been caught up in a ship war with a crackship like Jonsa over this long two year hiatus. I am pretty certain that Jon will have very limited scenes with Sansa next season considering he will be reuniting back with the characters that form a big part of his story in the books - Arya, Bran, Sam, Ghost etc. I bet that little hug we saw in the 1 second promo and some other scenes with everyone else in the great hall of WF in episode one is all the Jon/Sansa interaction we will have next season. Sansa has her own story to do after that and Jon has his.

If the Jon/Dany ship is going to be threatened by any relationship next season in terms of time devoted to their relationship on screen, it’s going to be Jon/Arya  😂. GRRM has all that time invested in Jon/Arya over 5 books and we are going to see how it all ends between them next season and Jon & Arya have always had that special bond.

I am sure that the Jonarya shippers are just waiting in the wings biding their time till next season 😂. I don’t think we will get anything in the promos or trailers for them because their reunion is the most awaited event of next season.

As a Jon fan though, next season is going to be a feast of character interactions for him - Jon-Arya, Jon-Ghost, Jon-Sam, Jon - Bran, Jon -Jaime!

Besides Jon-Dany has just started and we have to see how their relationship progresses as well!

tags: im so Tired of seeing her interpreted as an anti social loner
and of having her girlhood disregarded
summary: also i keep reading in these goddess archetype books about the connection between community and the feminine. which makes sense....
body: also i keep reading in these goddess archetype books about the connection between community and the feminine. which makes sense. women (for better of worse) are associated with nurturing, motherhood, and family. the larger sense of community is just on a greater scale. and thats what arya is all about. her objective is her pack. its being a part of a community; protecting and providing for each other. also learning from and listening to members of the community which we see arya doing from winterfell to braavos. arya’s core value, community, is actually feminine in nature.

summary: La muerte no es lo peor que nos puede pasar -le respondió el hombre bondadoso-. Es su regalo para nosotros, el fin de los...
body:
La muerte no es lo peor que nos puede pasar -le respondió el hombre bondadoso-. Es su regalo para nosotros, el fin de los anhelos y el dolor. El día en que nacemos, el Dios de Muchos Rostros nos envía a cada uno un ángel oscuro que recorre la vida a nuestro lado. Cuando nuestros pecados y sufrimientos son una carga demasiado grande, él ángel nos toma de la mano y nos lleva a las tierras de la noche, donde las estrellas brillan siempre. Los que vienen a beber de l Copa negra están buscando a sus ángeles. Si tienen miedo, las velas los tranquilizan. ¿En qué piensas cuando hueles las velas, mi niña?

《En Invernalia -le podría haber respondido-. Huele a la risas de Hodor, y a Jon y a Robb entrenándose juntos en el patio, y a Sansa cantando alguna canción idiota sobre alguna bella dama. Huelen a las criptas donde están los reyes de piedra; huelen a pan caliente en el horno; huelen al bosque de dioses. Huelen a mi loba y huelen a su pelaje; es casi como si la tuviera al lado.》

El día en que nacemos, el Dios de Muchos Rostros nos envía a cada uno un ángel oscuro que recorre la vida a nuestro lado. Cuando nuestros pecados y sufrimientos son una carga demasiado grande, él ángel nos toma de la mano y nos lleva a las tierras de la noche, donde las estrellas brillan siempre. Los que vienen a beber de l Copa negra están buscando a sus ángeles. Si tienen miedo, las velas los tranquilizan. ¿En qué piensas cuando hueles las velas, mi niña?

《En Invernalia -le podría haber respondido-. Huele a la risas de Hodor, y a Jon y a Robb entrenándose juntos en el patio, y a Sansa cantando alguna canción idiota sobre alguna bella dama. Huelen a las criptas donde están los reyes de piedra; huelen a pan caliente en el horno; huelen al bosque de dioses. Huelen a mi loba y huelen a su pelaje; es casi como si la tuviera al lado.》
trail.content:
La muerte no es lo peor que nos puede pasar -le respondió el hombre bondadoso-. Es su regalo para nosotros, el fin de los anhelos y el dolor. El día en que nacemos, el Dios de Muchos Rostros nos envía a cada uno un ángel oscuro que recorre la vida a nuestro lado. Cuando nuestros pecados y sufrimientos son una carga demasiado grande, él ángel nos toma de la mano y nos lleva a las tierras de la noche, donde las estrellas brillan siempre. Los que vienen a beber de l Copa negra están buscando a sus ángeles. Si tienen miedo, las velas los tranquilizan. ¿En qué piensas cuando hueles las velas, mi niña?

《En Invernalia -le podría haber respondido-. Huele a la risas de Hodor, y a Jon y a Robb entrenándose juntos en el patio, y a Sansa cantando alguna canción idiota sobre alguna bella dama. Huelen a las criptas donde están los reyes de piedra; huelen a pan caliente en el horno; huelen al bosque de dioses. Huelen a mi loba y huelen a su pelaje; es casi como si la tuviera al lado.》

blog.name: i-crossed-the-narrow-sea
blog.title: Valar Morghulis
blog.description: I'm here mostly for Arya x Jaqen or Jaqarya, if you prefer, amazing fanfiction authors whose stories help me to deal with the damage the showmakers did to Arya and Jaqen storyline, especially Braavos part. Obsessed with Jaqen H'ghar and Arya Stark and the House of Black and White ;) I love Braavos above all and I hope Arya and Jaqen story will be much better in the next book than what we've got so far in the show. I also love Tyrion  Lannister (really hope he'll get better lines next season), Jon Snow and ser Bronn of the Blackwater. I ship Arya and Jaqen, Tyrion and Tysha (I believe there is hope for them in the book) , Jaime and Brienne, Sansa and Sandor though I also like the idea of Sansa reuniting with Tyrion. I believe Rhaegar Targaryen never raped  Lyanna Stark but saved her from awful Robert Baratheon.
